overview: Animal photographer Olga Michi shows viewers the rarest and most inaccessible representatives of wildlife face to face. Each issue of the program is one journey, during which a portrait gallery is born, for example, mountain gorillas, Komodo lizards or a unique population of elephants in the equatorial multi-tiered forest of central Africa. How did man manage to make forest elephants dangerous? And will an extreme photographer be able to get close to wild elephants to make close-up portraits of them?
title: What Forest Elephants Talk About
